alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:28AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Middlesex, east central King and Queen, Northumberland, southeastern Richmond, southeastern Westmoreland, southeastern Essex and Lancaster Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1128 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Callao to near Center Cross. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Callao around 1135 AM EDT. Lewisetta around 1145 AM EDT. Heathsville around 1200 PM EDT. Jamaica around 1205 PM EDT. Urbanna, Church View and Morattico around 1215 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Lottsburg, Avalon, Brook Vale, Bertrand, Reedville, Belle Isle State Park, Millenbeck, Crouch, Mascot and Dodlyt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland
